info.title: Auto-generated OAS of Proxy-Print using OOPS

404.description: Not Found - consumer does not exist

get.description: Secured endpoint mapped to GET /api/secured. Requires the Spring Security role ROLE_USER. Returns a JSON object with a single property 'message'.

200.description: Successful response

value.message: Se estiveres autenticado, podes ver isto!

post.description: This method validates the login data from a user.

200.description: A JSON object with the authentication result.

get.description: This method allows a manager to get the list of employees from his printshop.

200.description: A JSON object indicating success and, when success=true, the list of employees.

put.description: This method allows a manager to edit a employee from his printshop.

id.description: Employee identifier (used to find the employee to edit)

200.description: Successful operation

post.description: This method allows a manager to add a employee to his printshop.

200.description: A JSON object indicating success or failure. On success returns 'success': true and 'id' of the created employee. On failure returns 'success': false and optional 'message'.

delete.description: This method allows a manager to delete a employee from his printshop.

parameters.description: ID of the employee to delete
parameters.name: employeeID

200.description: Successful response (success true) or failure (success false).

get.description: This method allows a manager to get the statistics info from his printshop.

200.description: Successful response with statistics when manager and printshop exist; otherwise success=false.

get.description: This method allows manager to get his printshop info

200.description: Successful operation

post.description: This method allows to add a register request to a new printshop.

requestBody.description: RegisterRequest to create

200.description: Successful operation. Returns the saved RegisterRequest.

post.description: This method allows the admin to accept a register request from a printshop.

parameters.description: ID of the register request to accept
parameters.name: id

200.description: JSON object indicating success or failure

post.description: This method allows the admin to reject a register request from a printshop.

parameters.description: ID of the register request to reject
parameters.name: printRequestID

requestBody.description: Rejection motive (plain text)

200.description: A JSON object indicating success or failure.

get.summary: Returns a list of pending register requests.
get.description: This method allows the admin to get a list of pending register requests.

200.description: OK

get.description: This method returns a list of the nearest printshops.

parameters.description: Latitude of the location used to compute nearest printshops
parameters.name: latitude

parameters.description: Longitude of the location used to compute nearest printshops
parameters.name: longitude

200.description: A JSON object with success flag and, when successful, a mapping of distances to PrintShop objects.

printshops.description: Mapping of distance (as stringified number) to PrintShop representation. Present when success is true.

get.description: This method returns a pricetable of a specific printshop.

200.description: Successful response

printcopy.description: Serialized papers price table (structure produced by the server)

rings.description: Array of binding/ring items with their prices

covers.description: Array of cover items with their prices

success.description: Indicates whether the pricetable was successfully retrieved

get.description: Returns the corresponding request from a printshop. Secured (ROLE_MANAGER, ROLE_EMPLOYEE).

200.description: A JSON object containing the print request and a success flag.

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful

post.description: Returns the new status of the corresponding print request.

200.description: JSON object with operation result. 'success' indicates whether the operation succeeded. On success, 'newStatus' contains the updated status (e.g., IN_PROGRESS, FINISHED, LIFTED).

get.description: Returns the pending and in progress requests from a printshop.

200.description: A JSON object containing the list of print requests and a success flag.

get.description: Returns the history of requests from a printshop.

200.description: Successful response containing the history requests and a success flag.

items.description: PrintRequest object (schema not provided in the inspected source)

get.description: Returns the satisfied requests from a printshop.

200.description: A JSON object containing satisfied requests and a success flag

post.description: This method allows a employee to cancel a print resquest.

requestBody.description: Cancellation motive as a raw string

200.description: A JSON object indicating success or failure

get.description: This method returns the printshop info

200.description: OK

get.description: This method returns a list of printshop with info from each one.

200.description: A JSON array of printshop objects.

get.description: This method allows employees to get a document by a given id.

200.description: OK - PDF document

Content-Disposition.description: Indicates if the content should be displayed inline and suggests a filename

Cache-Control.description: Caching directives set by the server

401.description: Unauthorized - employee not authorized for this printshop

get.description: 404 if the printshop doesn't exist.

200.description: OK

post.summary: Add a review to a printshop with the given ID
post.description: 404 if the printshop doesn't exist.

200.description: OK

put.description: 404 if the printshop or the review doesn't exist.

requestBody.description: Parameters to edit the review. Expected fields: review (string), rating (integer). The controller reads parameters via WebRequest.getParameter, so these may be provided as form data or as JSON.

200.description: OK

401.description: Unauthorized - the authenticated user is not the owner of the review.

404.description: Not Found - printshop or review doesn't exist.

delete.description: 404 if the printshop or the review doesn't exist.

200.description: OK

put.description: Edition of a new Paper Item from a price table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: PaperTableItem to edit in the price table

200.description: Successful operation

post.description: Addition of a new Paper Item to a price table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: PaperTableItem to add to the print shop price table

200.description: Operation result indicating success or failure

post.description: Delete a new Paper Item from a price table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: PaperTableItem to delete from the price table

200.description: Success/insuccess response

put.description: Edition of an existing Rings Item to a price table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: RingTableItem to edit

200.description: Operation result indicating success or failure

post.description: Addition of a new Rings Item to a price table of a certain print shop.

ringType.description: Presentation string for ring type (e.g. 'Argolas de Plstico', 'Argolas Espiral', 'Argolas de Arame').

infLim.description: Inclusive lower limit for the binding/ring range.

supLim.description: Inclusive upper limit for the binding/ring range.

price.description: Price as string (the server parses it to float).

200.description: Operation result indicating success or failure

post.description: Delete an existing Rings Item from a price table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: RingTableItem to delete

ringType.description: Presentation string for ring type (e.g. "Argolas de Plstico", "Argolas Espiral", "Argolas de Arame")

infLim.description: Lower limit (inclusive) of the ring binding range

supLim.description: Upper limit (inclusive) of the ring binding range

price.description: Price representation (not used by delete but present on the model)

200.description: Operation result

put.description: Edit an existent Cover Item to a price table of a certain print shop.

200.description: Operation result

post.summary: Add a new Cover Item to a price table of a certain print shop.
post.description: Add a new Cover Item to a price table of a certain print shop. Secured: requires ROLE_MANAGER.

requestBody.description: CoverTableItem object containing coverType, priceA4 and priceA3

priceA4.description: Price for A4 format or "-" if not set

priceA3.description: Price for A3 format or "-" if not set

200.description: Operation result indicating success or failure

post.description: Delete an existent Cover Item to a price table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: CoverTableItem

200.description: Returns success/insuccess

put.description: Edit the stapling price property table of a certain print shop.

requestBody.description: New stapling price provided as a raw string (will be parsed to a float server-side). Example: "2.5"

200.description: Operation result

get.summary: Returns the list of all printshops.
get.description: This method allows the admin entity to access all printshop's information registered in the platform.

200.description: Successful response returning a JSON object with 'prinshops' (a JSON-encoded string of PrintShop list) and 'success' boolean.

prinshops.description: A JSON-encoded string representing a list (JSON array) of PrintShop objects.

post.description: This method allows the register of an admin entity.

requestBody.description: Admin object to register

200.description: OK

post.description: This method allows developers to fill in the database with fake but consistent data.

200.description: OK

post.description: This method allows developers to fill in the database with fake consumer accounts.

200.description: OK

post.description: This method sends a notification to a consumer.

200.description: Successful operation

get.description: This method retrieves to consumer his list of notifications.

200.description: A list of notifications.

put.description: This method allows consumers to mark a notification as read.

200.description: Success

delete.description: This method allows consumers to delete a notification.

parameters.description: Identifier of the notification to delete.
parameters.name: notificationId

200.description: Successful deletion

post.description: Calculates budgets for a specified print request. Expects a multipart/form-data request with a required part named "printRequest" containing a JSON string (including 'printshops' and 'files' info) and one or more uploaded PDF files whose form keys match the file names referenced in the 'files' mapping.

requestBody.description: Multipart form data with the 'printRequest' part (JSON string) and uploaded PDF files. The 'printRequest' JSON must include 'printshops' (array of numeric IDs) and 'files' (mapping file names to specs). Uploaded file form fields should match file names used in the 'files' mapping (e.g. 'document.pdf'). Only PDF files (extension .pdf) are processed.

printRequest.description: JSON string describing the print request (must include 'printshops' and 'files').

additionalProperties.description: One or more uploaded files (PDF expected). Keys are the file field names; they should match the file names referenced inside the 'files' mapping in the printRequest JSON (e.g. 'mydoc.pdf').

200.description: Successful operation  budgets calculated

budgets.description: Mapping from printshop ID to computed budget string.

post.description: This method allows clients to POST a print request and associate it to a given printshop with a given budget. The payment may or may not occur according to the payment method.

parameters.description: ID of the print request to finish and submit
parameters.name: printRequestID

printshopID.description: ID of the PrintShop to which the print request will be submitted

budget.description: Budget/cost associated with the chosen printshop

paymentMethod.description: Payment method (e.g. proxy payment or PayPal)

200.description: Result of the submission attempt

value.message: No possu saldo suficiente para efetuar o pedido.

post.description: This method allows other platforms to print a document using ProxyPrint. The endpoint accepts multipart/form-data with one or more file parts; only files with a PDF extension are processed. A PrintRequest is created and documents are stored with default specifications. The response contains a success flag and the created printRequestID.

requestBody.description: Multipart form data with one or more files. Part names are arbitrary; non-PDF files are ignored by the server.

200.description: Successful response containing success flag and created printRequestID

get.description: This method returns the document from a print request

200.description: A JSON object with a success flag and, when successful, the list of documents for the print request.

post.description: This method calculates budgets for a given and already specified print request. The budgets are calculated for specific printshops also passed along as parameters.

requestBody.description: JSON array of printshop IDs

200.description: Successful response with budgets

budgets.description: Map of printshop ID to budget (string values)

post.description: This method implements the payment check mechanism given by PayPal. This method acts as callback, it reacts to the change of status of a transaction to Completed (eCheck - complete).

200.description: No content

post.summary: It confirms that a certain consumer has pay its load up on ProxyPrint.
post.description: Its a route for being remotely called by PayPal servers.

parameters.description: ID of the consumer whose balance is being updated
parameters.name: consumerID

requestBody.description: PayPal IPN POST body (form-urlencoded). Fields referenced by the controller: payer_email, mc_gross, payment_status, txn_id.

payer_email.description: Payer email as provided by PayPal IPN (map key 'payer_email')

payment_status.description: Payment status posted by PayPal (map key 'payment_status')

200.description: No response body (IPN processed).

post.description: This method allows consumer registration.

requestBody.description: Form parameters for consumer registration

200.description: A JSON object indicating success and, on success, the created consumer or, on failure, an error message.

consumer.description: Created consumer object (structure inferred from the model); represented as free-form here.

get.description: This method allows consumers to get their personal information.

200.description: Successful response containing the consumer information and success flag.

consumer.description: Serialized Consumer object as returned by the server.

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful.

401.description: Unauthorized - authentication is required to access this resource.

403.description: Forbidden - the authenticated principal does not have the required role (ROLE_USER).

put.description: This method allows consumers to update their personal information.

requestBody.description: Consumer JSON object with updated fields (deserialized into io.github.proxyprint.kitchen.models.consumer.Consumer).

schema.description: Consumer object (fields as expected by the server).

200.description: Success/insuccess response

put.description: This method allows consumers to mark as read all notifications.

200.description: OK

delete.description: This method allows consumers to remove all notifications.

parameters.description: The username of the consumer whose notifications will be deleted.
parameters.name: username

200.description: Successful deletion of all notifications.

get.description: This method retrieves to the consumer his pending requests.

200.description: Successful response with pending print requests and a success flag.

delete.description: This method allows consumers to cancel a pending request.

200.description: A JSON object indicating success or failure.

get.description: This method retrieves the history of satisfied requests from a consumer.

200.description: A JSON object with the consumer's satisfied print requests and success flag.

get.description: Returns the consumer's balance, normaly used for update purposes.

200.description: Successful response containing the consumer's balance and success flag

balance.description: Money object representing the consumer's balance

get.summary: Returns a set of the printing schemas.
get.description: This method allows consumers to get his PrintingSchemas.

parameters.description: id, the id of the consumer.
parameters.name: consumerID

200.description: A JSON object containing success flag and, if successful, the pschemas array.

post.description: This method allows consumers to add a new printing schema to his printing schemas collection.

requestBody.description: PrintingSchema to add to the consumer's collection.

200.description: Successful operation. On success returns {"success": true, "id": <created id>}; on failure returns {"success": false}.

put.description: This method allows consumers to edit a printing schema from his printing schemas collection.

requestBody.description: PrintingSchema object with fields to update (name, bindingSpecs, coverSpecs, paperSpecs)

200.description: Printing schema updated successfully

delete.description: This method allows consumers to delete a printing schema from his printing schemas collection.

parameters.description: The id of the printing schema to delete.
parameters.name: printingSchemaID

200.description: JSON object indicating success or failure of the deletion.

success.description: Indicates whether the deletion succeeded (true) or not (false).

false.description: Present in the implementation when the printing schema was already deleted (property name as returned by the controller).
